      public java.lang.String[] vigenereKeys​(java.lang.String text)
      Gives the most likely keys for the given text.
      Parameters:
      text - The input text to be text.
      Returns:
      The most likely key used to encrypt the text.

    • keyGuesserVigenere

      public java.lang.String[] keyGuesserVigenere​(int keyLength, java.lang.String text)
      Provides the most likely strings which could be the keys to a vigenere cipher.
      Parameters:
      keyLength - The predicted length of the key.
      text - The encrypted text.
      Returns:
      The most likely key for the given text and key length.

    • computeFractionalMS

      public double computeFractionalMS​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> letterOccurences, int length)
      Calculates the Bhattacharyya Distance between the letters in a given string and the expected letter distribution for English. Lower is better.
      Parameters:
      letterOccurences - A map containing the integer occurrences of given letters in the text to be examined.
      length - The total length of the string from which the integer letter occurrences are drawn from.
      Returns:
      The Bhattacharyya Distance between the expected frequencies of English letters and the observed distribution.

    • bhattacharyyaDistance

      private double bhattacharyyaDistance​(double[] p, double[] q)
      Calculates the Bhattacharyya Distance between two necessarily categorical distributions.,
      Parameters:
      p - The first distribution.
      q - The second distribution
      Returns:
      The Bhattacharyya Distance between both distributions.

    • mostLikelyKeyLength

      public int mostLikelyKeyLength​(int[] likelyKeys, java.lang.String text)
      Determines the most likely key length for a given text.
      Parameters:
      text - The polyalphabetically enciphered text.
      likelyKeys - An array of the lengths of possible keys used to encipher the text.
      Returns:
      The most likely key length.

    • likelyKeyLengths

      public int[] likelyKeyLengths​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> repeated, java.lang.String text)
      Gives numbers representing the possible key lengths for a polyalphabetically encrypted text. If the key length is larger than any given value, it is likely to be a multiple. The cutoff value for recommending keys, is 50% the occurences of the most common factor. This seems to always locate the key somewhere in the array though I don't yet understand why.
      Parameters:
      repeated - A map of the repeated sequences of a given length in the text.
      text - The polyalphabetically encrypted text.
      Returns:
      An array of the possible key lengths of the text and their respective occurences.

    • maxKeyInt

      private java.lang.Integer maxKeyInt​(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer> map)
      Returns the key corresponding to the maximum value in a Map
      Parameters:
      map - The input Map.
      Returns:
      The key corresponding to the maximum value in the map.

    • factorise

      private java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer> factorise​(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer> foundFactors, int n)
      Create a map with all prime factors in the differences between repeated strings and their relative occurrences.
      Parameters:
      foundFactors - A map corresponding to the factors of the differences between repeated strings and their relative number of occurrences.
      n - The number to be factorized.
      Returns:
      The map updated with n's factors.

    • combinations

      private void combinations​(java.lang.String[][] input, java.lang.String[] currentKey, int counter)
      Takes a 2D array of strings and outputs all the possible combinations of that array.
      Parameters:
      input - The 2D (Likely truncated) String[] containing all the possible letters at each point in the key.
      currentKey - The current combination of letters being produced by the function.
      counter - A variable to keep track how deep in the 2D array the function is.
